familyData.name: Fredelito Madigal
familyData.text: My father was once driver, security guard, and a small businessman. He does all this to provide for our family. He's one of my idol.

familyData.name: Daisybel Tolentino
familyData.text: My mother was once a housekeeping staff. She is very hardworking in both fields, from motherhood to work. She is a very loving and caring mother. She is my inspiration in life.

familyData.name: Jeffrey Tolentino
familyData.text: He's my step-father, he really does provide for the family just what he promised to my mother. Really grateful to have him supporting the faimly.

familyData.name: Reena Kaye L. Madigal
familyData.text: Second child of my biological parents. She's good at cooking and designing. As she's just one year younger than me, we share couple of ideals in life.

familyData.name: Keed Nahaleel L. Madigal
familyData.text: Third child of my biological parents. He's a very playful and energetic kid. He loves to play games and watch anime.

familyData.name: Kathleen Joy L. Madigal
familyData.text: Fourth child of my biological parents and the last child for my father's side. She's a very smart and talented kid. She loves her church duty and also to sing.

familyData.name: Scxian Ely L. Madigal
familyData.text: Last child of my mother and first child of my step-father. Right now, she's still a kid and loves to play with her toys. She's very cute and adorable.

challengesData.title: Enrollment System Issue
challengesData.challenges: Our team encountered deployment issue that led the team to have bad grades. This is because we have lack of knowledge about the deployment process and what bugs we could encounter
challengesData.learnings: I researched and also led myself to experience different bugs for the deployment for me to find the answer in each problem. I use this technique to train myself about error handling and the right way of deployment.

challengesData.title: Lack of Technical Groupmates
challengesData.challenges: I have experience to code alone admist of my background (I am STEM Studdent, coding haven't taught in my SHS years), this is due to lack of equipments of my groupmates.
challengesData.learnings: Coding alone is hard, but experiencing various errors could guide you to knowledge. I've adjusted my pace on learning and multitask for frontend, backend, and database.

challengesData.title: Lack of Knowledge about TechStacks
challengesData.challenges: We've created an e-commerce about a construction services. Due to lack or knowledge in techstacks and also shortage of resources, our system isn't finished when we submitted it.
challengesData.learnings: We search on tools, libraries, frameworks, and other more ready to use resources to ease the time consumption on building each part in our systems.

plansData.title: Long Term Goals
plansData.description: Looking beyond graduation, my long-term aspirations are centered on establishing a robust career in tech and specializing in cybersecurity. The primary goal is to successfully finish college and secure a challenging entry-level position that allows me to make experience in the corporate world. This will involve continuous learning, seeking mentorship within my workplace, and consistently performing well to take on new responsibilities. As I gain more professional experience, I'll actively refactor my portfolios with a strong base of experience, showcasing contributions to real-world projects, writing technical blogs, and potentially contributing to open-source initiatives. My ultimate specialization lies in cybersecurity; therefore, I plan to learn and apply to cybersecurity by pursuing to this industry, engaging in hands-on labs and CTFs, and networking within the cybersecurity community to eventually transition into a specialized role in the field.

plansData.title: Short Term Goals
plansData.description: My short-term priorities are doing well in school and actively laying the groundwork for my future career.  I'll make restructuring and correcting errors in earlier systems a priority this semester by setting aside a certain amount of time to go over previous projects and improve their documentation, efficiency, and code quality while maintaining appropriate version control on sites like GitHub.  At the same time, I want to graduate from college with honors, keeping up solid grades, and working hard to get ready for the capstone project and future classes.  Even before my official internship begins, I will actively look for ways to obtain experience in the corporate world.  This entails going to online career fairs, connecting with industry experts on LinkedIn, and looking into volunteer or freelance coding projects to put my abilities to use. At the same time, I'll start to restructure my portfolio by adding these enhanced academic assignments and any fresh experiences, emphasizing clear explanations, clean code, and a solid foundation of proven abilities.
